title: Pike & Joyce 2013 Rapide Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: This refreshing, light Pinot Noir is redolent of thyme and bay leaf, then adds juicy cherries on the palate. It does finish a little austere, with some drying tannins, so avoid the temptation of serving it with salmon and instead try a chilled beef salad or roast beef sandwich.

title: Poças 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)
description: This simple, fruity, red-berry-flavored wine has bright acidity along with soft tannins. It's a great barbecue style of wine, fruity and ready to go with grilled meat.

title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)
description: A mix of floral, tropical and citrus aromas is more than fine. A snappy citric palate is racy and high in cleansing acidity. Citrus flavors are plain and simple, while this is entirely clean and fresh on the finish.

title: Alfredo Roca 2015 Roca Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of mango and scented potpourri set up a dry solid palate. This blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay is not something you see a lot of. Flavors of white pepper and nectarine finish juicy, with notes of peach pit and orange peel.

title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Cuvée Clémence  (Entre-Deux-Mers)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine has light wood aging to smooth out its herbal character and bring out the richer Sémillon. Spice, toast and crisp acidity are filled out with the ripeness of the vintage. Drink this from early 2017.

title: College Cellars 2015 Roussanne (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of apricot and other stone fruit are light but pleasing. The palate shows elegance and detail, with ale notes on the finish.

title: Delfino 2013 Reserve Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Sturdy and tannic, this offers subtle suggestions of rosewater and cocoa powder around pleasant plum fruit. Drink it over the next two or three years; decanting will help to smooth it out.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Aluado Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Ripe apricot and pear flavors give this wine a rich character. It is packed with fruits with a creamy texture and balanced acidity at the end. This crisp wine is ready to drink.

title: Dogliotti 1870 2015  Moscato d'Asti
description: The nose is quite shy but the palate is more expressive, offering white peach, mature green apple and candied nectarine zest. A light frothy mousse and fresh acidity brighten the rich flavors.

title: Cerulean 2013 Acadia Vineyards White Space Blend White (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: This is a dry, crisp, forward, well-aged wine that blends five aromatic white grapes, principally Gruner Veltliner and Pinot Gris. Already showing signs of oxidation, it's a pleasant, though nondescript white wine that should be consumed by 2018.

title: Château du Vieux Puit 2014 Cuvée Croizet  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A fruity, tank-aged wine that has spice, stalky black-currant fruit and some dry tannins. It is juicy and lightly perfumed with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. It takes its name from the beehive shaped wells (puit) typical of the north of the Gironde. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Haut Selve 2015  Graves
description: This is a fresh and fruity wine with lively acidity and spice from wood aging. Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, it is herbal and still young, needing time to develop. Drink this crisp wine from late 2017.

title: Château la Freynelle 2015 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)
description: The wine is still firmly structured and dark. Tannins dominate what will become attractive red-berry fruits. With the acidity and concentration, this will be a fine wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Very dry and not overly fruity, this medium-bodied wine brings subtle earthy, savory flavors and a firm, straightforward mouthfeel, with a touch of astringency on the finish.

title: Black Cabra 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: An edgy nose with cassis, plum and cherry aromas is upright and fresh. This is lively and a bit jagged in feel, with cassis, cherry and chocolaty oak flavors. A firm finish with rubbery grabby tannins closes this out.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2015 Dissonance Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 90% Sauvignon Blanc with 10% Sémillon, this white is perfumed in jasmine and apricot honey. On the palate it becomes somewhat fleshier and less expressive, allowing for just a hint of peach.

title: Boatique 2014 Musque Sauvignon Blanc (Big Valley District-Lake County)
description: This wine is relatively full bodied and ripe tasting, while also backed up by enough acidity to keep it refreshing. It tastes like crisp green apples with a hint of fresh herbs.

title: Bota Box 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This tangy, light-bodied wine wakes up the nose with a vivid herb and citrus aroma, and livens up the palate with fresh lemon and green-apple flavors. The texture melts slightly around the edges to keep it smooth on the finish.

title: Bridlewood 2014 G-S-M (Santa Barbara County)
description: Caramelized blackberry, beef jerky and sweet tar arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows vanilla, blackberry, blueberry and a touch of asphalt. The tannins are a bit scattered, but the pepper spice is nice.

title: California Republic 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine has attractive butter, ripe apple and pear aromas, and is nice and fruity in style. An almost-sweet sensation rounds out the texture, and tasty accents of baking spices and vanilla keep coming with each sip.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2014 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Full-bodied and forward, this offers fruit flavors of spiced cherry, along with a broad streak of vanilla. The tannins hit hard and carry a slightly charred, slightly bitter aftertaste.

title: Quinta Foz Torto 2013 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This wine is spicy with ripe tannins and juicy berry fruits. It is soft and ready to drink with its balanced fruitiness and acidity.

title: Peirano 2013 The Heritage Collection Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This wine smells and tastes like blackberry syrup, with a touch of sweetness on the palate to match. One of the easier-to-drink versions of the variety, it has a smooth texture and broad mouthfeel.

title: Josep Grau Viticultor 2014 Vespres Red (Montsant)
description: Cherry cough drop and cassis aromas are red in nature. Dense and compact on the palate, with plum and currant flavors, this finishes with residual tannic rub and increasingly intense berry fruit. Elegance and charm are fleeting.

title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Rosé (Yakima Valley)
description: A pretty pale peach color, the strawberry aromas are quite light while the flavors are tart and spritely. It piques the interest.

title: Laughinghouse Vintners 2014 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)
description: This medium-bodied, dark-colored wine has smoky, peppery aromas and flavors, and a firmly tannic texture. Dry and on the lean side in term of flavor, it will pair nicely with rich foods.

title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2015 Branco White (Douro)
description: Produced from vines aged between 25 and 30 years old, this is a ripe yellow and citrus-flavored wine. It has a strongly mineral edge as well as crisp, tight fruitiness. With its structure and tension, it is likely to age further. Drink from late 2017.

title: Marcarini 2015  Moscato d'Asti
description: Exuberant aromas of yellow stone fruit and lime jump out of the glass. The bright friendly palate doles out ripe apricot and pear while a hint of candied nectarine wraps up the close.

title: Luigi Bosca 2014 Gala 4 Cabernet Franc-Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Herbal plum, tomato and animal aromas get this high-acid Cab Franc going. In the mouth, the first sensation is scouring acidity, although with time a general sense of freshness takes over. Flavors of tart red plum, tomato and pie cherry finish screechy.

title: Frank 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Semillon White (Limestone Coast)
description: This tasty, medium-bodied blend is about half Sauvignon Blanc, with the balance split almost evenly between Chardonnay and Semillon. Struck flint marks the nose, while the flavors suggest hints of asparagus and fig. Drink now.
